If you care about health care, and climate change, and building a 21st Century infrastructure system, and affordable housing, and any other investment the government can make‚Äîthen I urge you ‚Äì care about the debt and deficits. #utpol

I care about debt & deficits because a strong fiscal house means we have a stronger country, that $383 billion spent on interest payments on our debt is $383 billion we can‚Äôt spend on other priorities such as clean energy, and transportation, and affordable health care. #utpol
Look at the @HouseBlueDogs Priorities on Fiscal Responsibility and you will see a comprehensive list of pragmatic steps we can take‚Äîsome of which we‚Äôve already taken. http://bit.ly/2JHqmVP¬†

Both parties and Republican and Democratic administrations have contributed to the problem. The question is: what are we going to do about it and when will we start to get our borrowing and spending addiction under control? #utpol

As we‚Äôve done more than 100 times, we are preparing to vote to raise the debt limit. Raising it does not authorize new spending; it enables the government to pay its bills. What better time to pair that vote with a plan to reform our government spending? #utpol

We know that the costs of barreling towards this fiscal cliff are already mounting. American taxpayers foot the bill for additional borrowing costs that come from delays in extending the debt limit. #utpol

Speaking on the House floor on the @HouseBlueDogs balanced budget blueprint. We must act now to reduce the debt.

A bill I introduced, the Solar Energy Research and Development Act, advanced today and will go to the House for a vote. It will reauthorize the Dept. of Energy to do research on solar technologies, leading to innovations in our clean energy economy. #utpol 

News release: pic.twitter.com/CH7RN0xntS
This bill combats climate change by creating jobs, securing our grid, and helps produce clean reliable energy. #utpol

Utah is a national leader in solar development. We rank 10th in solar production in the country, and we are projected to produce 1,079 megawatts of solar energy in the next 5 years. Solar investments have contributed $2.63 billion to the Utah economy. #utpol

It also aids w/ developing solar as a reliable source of energy, lessening our dependence on foreign markets, and building a stronger and more secure grid. Solar innovation also continues to drive the cost of renewable energy lower ‚Äì helping the environment and consumers. #utpol

My bill would reauthorize the Dept. of Energy to pursue solar energy research, development and project demonstrations. This includes developing solar technologies that expand the capacity and efficiency of solar energy. @HouseScience #utpol
